Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with two lugs. The two perforations, relatively large for the size of blade, are misaligned and positioned too near the butt. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product. There is considerable surface pitting and erosion of the edges, and there is a large crack at the centre of the butt. The line of the original haft is revealed by the pattern of the corrosion damage near the butt.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (40)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
